member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.Aggregates
member.summary: Configures the Grid aggregate rows. > Check the [`Aggregates`](../../grid/aggregates/) for its configuration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowExcelExport
member.summary: If `allowExcelExport` set to true, then it will allow the user to export grid to Excel file.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowFiltering
member.summary: If `allowFiltering` set to true the filter bar will be displayed. If set to false the filter bar will not be displayed. Filter bar allows the user to filter grid records with required criteria.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowGrouping
member.summary: If `allowGrouping` set to true, then it will allow the user to dynamically group or ungroup columns. Grouping can be done by drag and drop columns from column header to group drop area.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowMultiSorting
member.summary: If `allowMultiSorting` set to true, then it will allow the user to sort multiple column in the grid. > `allowSorting` should be true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowPaging
member.summary: If `allowPaging` is set to true, the pager renders at the footer of the Grid. It is used to handle page navigation in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowPdfExport
member.summary: If `allowPdfExport` set to true, then it will allow the user to export grid to Pdf file.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowReordering
member.summary: If `allowReordering` is set to true, Grid columns can be reordered. Reordering can be done by drag and drop of a particular column from one index to another index. > If Grid is rendered with stacked headers, reordering is allowed only at the same level as the column headers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowResizing
member.summary: If `allowResizing` is set to true, Grid columns can be resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowRowDragAndDrop
member.summary: If `allowRowDragAndDrop` is set to true, you can drag and drop grid rows at another grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowSelection
member.summary: If `allowSelection` is set to true, it allows selection of (highlight row) Grid records by clicking it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowSorting
member.summary: If `allowSorting` is set to true, it allows sorting of grid records when column header is clicked.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: If `allowTextWrap` set to true, then text content will wrap to the next line when its text content exceeds the width of the Column Cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.ChildGrid
member.summary: Defines Grid options to render child Grid. It requires the [`queryString`](grid/#querystring-string) for parent and child relationship.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.ClipMode
member.summary: Defines the mode of clip. The available modes are, `Clip`: Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis`: Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip`: Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area, also it will display the tooltip while hover on ellipsis is applied..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.ColumnMenuItems
member.summary:
`columnMenuItems` defines both built-in and custom column menu items.
The available built-in items are, `AutoFitAll` - Auto fit the size of all columns. `AutoFit` - Auto fit the current column. `Group` - Group by current column. `Ungroup` - Ungroup by current column. `SortAscending` - Sort the current column in ascending order. `SortDescending` - Sort the current column in descending order. `Filter` - Filter options will show based on filterSettings property like checkbox filter, excel filter, menu filter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.ColumnQueryMode
member.summary: `columnQueryMode`provides options to retrive data from the datasource.Their types are `All`: It Retrives whole datasource. `Schema`: Retrives data for all the defined columns in grid from the datasource. `ExcludeHidden`: Retrives data only for visible columns of grid from the dataSource.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.Columns
member.summary: Defines the schema of dataSource. If the `columns` declaration is empty or undefined then the `columns` are automatically generated from data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.ContextMenuItems
member.summary:
`contextMenuItems` defines both built-in and custom context menu items.
The available built-in items are, `AutoFitAll` - Auto fit the size of all columns. `AutoFit` - Auto fit the current column. `Group` - Group by current column. `Ungroup` - Ungroup by current column. `Edit` - Edit the current record. `Delete` - Delete the current record. `Save` - Save the edited record. `Cancel` - Cancel the edited state. `Copy` - Copy the selected records. `PdfExport` - Export the grid as Pdf format. `ExcelExport` - Export the grid as Excel format. `CsvExport` - Export the grid as CSV format. `SortAscending` - Sort the current column in ascending order. `SortDescending` - Sort the current column in descending order. `FirstPage` - Go to the first page. `PrevPage` - Go to the previous page. `LastPage` - Go to the last page. `NextPage` - Go to the next page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.CurrentAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the current action details.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.DataSource
member.summary: It is used to render grid table rows. If the `dataSource` is an array of JavaScript objects, then Grid will create instance of [`DataManager`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-dataManager.html) from this `dataSource`. If the `dataSource` is an existing [`DataManager`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-dataManager.html), the Grid will not initialize a new one.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.DetailTemplate
member.summary: The detail template allows you to show or hide additional information about a particular row.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.EditSettings
member.summary: Configures the edit settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.EnableAltRow
member.summary: If `enableAltRow` is set to true, the grid will render with `e-altrow` CSS class to the alternative tr elements. > Check the [`AltRow`](../../grid/row/#styling-alternate-rows/) to customize the styles of alternative rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.EnableAutoFill
member.summary: If `enableAutoFill` is set to true, then the auto fill icon will displayed on cell selection for copy cells. It requires the selection `mode` to be Cell and `cellSelectionMode` to be `Box`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.EnableColumnVirtualization
member.summary: If `enableColumnVirtualization` set to true, then the Grid will render only the columns visible within the view-port and load subsequent columns on horizontal scrolling. This helps to load large dataset of columns in Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.EnableHeaderFocus
member.summary: If `enableHeaderFocus` set to true, then header element will be focused when focus moves to grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.EnableHover
member.summary: If `enableHover` is set to true, the row hover is enabled in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: If `enableVirtualization` set to true, then the Grid will render only the rows visible within the view-port and load subsequent rows on vertical scrolling. This helps to load large dataset in Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.FilterSettings
member.summary: Configures the filter settings of the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.FrozenColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frozen columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.FrozenRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frozen rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.GridLines
member.summary: Defines the mode of grid lines. The available modes are, `Both`: Displays both horizontal and vertical grid lines. `None`: No grid lines are displayed. `Horizontal`: Displays the horizontal grid lines only. `Vertical`: Displays the vertical grid lines only. `Default`: Displays grid lines based on the theme.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.GroupSettings
member.summary: Configures the group settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.Height
member.summary: Defines the scrollable height of the grid content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.HierarchyPrintMode
member.summary: Defines the hierarchy grid print modes. The available modes are `Expanded` - Prints the master grid with expanded child grids. `All` - Prints the master grid with all the child grids. `None` - Prints the master grid alone.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.PageSettings
member.summary: Configures the pager in the Grid.

member.summary: It used to render pager template

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.PrintMode
member.summary: Defines the print modes. The available print modes are `AllPages`: Prints all pages of the Grid. `CurrentPage`: Prints the current page of the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.Query
member.summary: Defines the external [`Query`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-query.html) that will be executed along with data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.EjsGrid`1.Toolbar
member.summary:
`toolbar` defines the ToolBar items of the Grid. It contains built-in and custom toolbar items. If a string value is assigned to the `toolbar` option, it is considered as the template for the whole Grid ToolBar. If an array value is assigned, it is considered as the list of built-in and custom toolbar items in the Grid's Toolbar.
The following code example implements the custom toolbar items.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.ClipMode
member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are `Clip` - Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType
member.summary: `columnQueryMode`provides options to retrive data from the datasource. They are All Schema ExcludeHidden

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridLine
member.summary: Defines modes of GridLine, They are Both - Displays both the horizontal and vertical grid lines. None - No grid lines are displayed. Horizontal - Displays the horizontal grid lines only. Vertical - Displays the vertical grid lines only. Default - Displays grid lines based on the theme.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.HierarchyGridPrintMode
member.summary: Hierarchy Grid Print modes are `Expanded` - Prints the master grid with expanded child grids. `All` - Prints the master grid with all the child grids. `None` - Prints the master grid alone.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.PrintMode
member.summary: Print mode options are AllPages - Print all pages records of the Grid. CurrentPage - Print current page records of the Grid.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.TextAlign
member.summary: Defines alignments of text, they are Left Right Center Justify

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.CommandButtonType
member.summary: Defines the Command Buttons type. Edit - Edit the current record. Delete - Delete the current record. Save - Save the current edited record. Cancel - Cancel the edited state.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.FilterBarMode
member.summary: Filter bar mode options are OnEnter - Initiate filter operation after Enter key is pressed. Immediate - Initiate filter operation after certain time interval. By default time interval is 1500 ms.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.FilterType
member.summary: Defines types of Filter Menu - Specifies the filter type as menu. Excel - Specifies the filter type as excel. FilterBar - Specifies the filter type as filter bar. CheckBox - Specifies the filter type as check box.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.SortDirection

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.CellSelectionMode

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.SelectionType

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.AllowEditing
member.summary: If `allowEditing` set to false, then it disables editing of a particular column. By default all columns are editable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.AllowFiltering
member.summary: If `allowFiltering` set to false, then it disables filtering option and filter bar element of a particular column. By default all columns are filterable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.AllowGrouping
member.summary: If `allowGrouping` set to false, then it disables grouping of a particular column. By default all columns are groupable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.AllowReordering
member.summary: If `allowReordering` set to false, then it disables reorder of a particular column. By default all columns can be reorder.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.AllowResizing
member.summary: If `allowResizing` set to false, it disables resize option of a particular column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.AllowSearching
member.summary: If `allowSearching` set to false, then it disables Searching of a particular column. By default all columns allow Searching.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.AllowSorting
member.summary: If `allowSorting` set to false, then it disables sorting option of a particular column. By default all columns are sortable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.AutoFit
member.summary: If `autoFit` set to true, then the particular column content width will be adjusted based on its content in the initial rendering itself. Setting this property as true is equivalent to calling `autoFitColumns` method in the `dataBound` event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.ClipMode
member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are `Clip` - Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Columns
member.summary: Used to render multiple header rows(stacked headers) on the Grid header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Commands
member.summary: `commands` provides an option to display command buttons in every cell. The available built-in command buttons are Edit - Edit the record. Delete - Delete the record. Save - Save the record. Cancel - Cancel the edit state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.CustomAttributes
member.summary: The CSS styles and attributes of the content cells of a particular column can be customized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.DataSource
member.summary: Defines the column data source which will act as foreign data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.DefaultValue
member.summary: Defines default values for the component when adding a new record to the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.DisableHtmlEncode
member.summary: If `disableHtmlEncode` is set to true, it encodes the HTML of the header and content cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.DisplayAsCheckBox
member.summary: If `displayAsCheckBox` is set to true, it displays the column value as a check box instead of Boolean value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Edit
member.summary: Defines the `IEditCell`(../../grid/edit/#cell-edit-template) object to customize default edit cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.EditTemplate
member.summary: Defines the cell edit template that used as editor for a particular column. It accepts either template string or HTML element ID.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.EditType
member.summary: Defines the type of component for editing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.EnableGroupByFormat
member.summary: If `enableGroupByFormat` set to true, then it groups the particular column by formatted values. By default no columns are group by format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of column which is mapped with mapping name of DataSource. The bounded columns can be sort, filter and group etc., If the `field` name contains dot, then it is considered as complex binding. The `field` name must be a valid JavaScript identifier, the first character must be an alphabet and should not contain spaces and special characters.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Filter
member.summary: Defines the filter options to customize filtering for the particular column. @default null

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.FilterBarTemplate
member.summary: The `filterBarTemplate` is used to add a custom component instead of default input component for filter bar. It have create and read functions. create: It is used for creating custom components. read: It is used to perform custom filter action.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.FilterTemplate
member.summary: Defines the filter template/UI that used as filter for a particular column. It accepts either template string or HTML element ID.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.ForeignKeyField
member.summary: Defines the mapping column name of the foreign data source. If it is not defined then the `columns.field` will be considered as mapping column name

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.ForeignKeyValue
member.summary: Defines the display column name from the foreign data source which will be obtained from comparing local and foreign data

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Format
member.summary: It is used to change display value with the given format and does not affect the original data. Gets the format from the user which can be standard or custom [`number`](../../common/internationalization/#manipulating-numbers) and [`date`](../../common/internationalization/#manipulating-datetime) formats.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridColumn.Formatter
member.summary: Defines the method which is used to achieve custom formatting from an external function. This function triggers before rendering of each cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridAggregate.Columns
member.summary: Configures the aggregate columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.ColumnName
member.summary: Defines the column name to display the aggregate value. If `columnName` is not defined, then `field` name value will be assigned to the `columnName` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.CustomAggregate
member.summary: Defines a function to calculate custom aggregate value. The `type` value should be set to `custom`. To use custom aggregate value in the template, use the key as `${custom}`. Total aggregation: The custom function will be called with the whole data and the current `AggregateColumn` object. Group aggregation: This will be called with the current group details and the `AggregateColumn` object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the column name to perform aggregation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Defines the footer cell template as a string for the aggregate column. The `type` name should be used to access aggregate values inside the template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.Format
member.summary: Format is applied to a calculated value before it is displayed. Gets the format from the user, which can be standard or custom [`number`](../../common/internationalization/#number-formatting/) and [`date`](../../common/internationalization/#number-formatting/) formats.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.GroupCaptionTemplate
member.summary: Defines the group caption cell template as a string for the aggregate column. The `type` name should be used to access aggregate values inside the template. Additionally, the following fields can be accessed in the template. field: The current grouped field name. key: The current grouped field value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.GroupFooterTemplate
member.summary: Defines the group footer cell template as a string for the aggregate column. The `type` name should be used to access aggregate values inside the template. Additionally, the following fields can be accessed in the template. field: The current grouped field. key: The current grouped value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.Type
member.summary: Defines the aggregate type of a particular column. To use multiple aggregates for single column, specify the `type` as array. Types of aggregate are, sum average max min count truecount falsecount custom > Specify the `type` value as `custom` to use custom aggregation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowAdding
member.summary: If `allowAdding` is set to true, new records can be added to the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowDeleting
member.summary: If `allowDeleting` is set to true, existing record can be deleted from the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowEditOnDblClick
member.summary: If `allowEditOnDblClick` is set to false, Grid will not allow editing of a record on double click.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowEditing
member.summary: If `allowEditing` is set to true, values can be updated in the existing record.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowNextRowEdit
member.summary: If allowNextRowEdit is set to true, editing is done to next row. By default allowNextRowEdit is set to false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of the filter column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: If ignoreAccent is set to true, then filter ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.MatchCase
member.summary: If match case set to true, then filter records with exact match or else filter records with case insensitive(uppercase and lowercase letters treated as same).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Operator
member.summary: Defines the operator to filter records. The available operators and its supported data types are:

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Predicate
member.summary: Defines the relationship between one filter query and another by using AND or OR predicate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Uid
member.summary: Defines the UID of filter column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterColumn.Value
member.summary: Defines the value used to filter records.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Columns
member.summary: Specifies the columns to be filtered at initial rendering of the Grid. You can also get the columns that were currently filtered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.EnableCaseSensitivity
member.summary: If `enableCaseSensitivity` is set to true then searches grid records with exact match based on the filter operator. It will have no effect on number, boolean and Date fields.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: If ignoreAccent set to true, then filter ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.ImmediateModeDelay
member.summary: Defines the time delay (in milliseconds) in filtering records when the `Immediate` mode of filter bar is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Mode
member.summary: Defines the filter bar modes. The available options are, `OnEnter`: Initiates filter operation after Enter key is pressed. `Immediate`: Initiates filter operation after a certain time interval. By default, time interval is 1500 ms.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Operators
member.summary: The `operators` is used to override the default operators in filter menu. This should be defined by type wise (string, number, date and boolean). Based on the column type, this customize operator list will render in filter menu.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.ShowFilterBarStatus
member.summary: Shows or hides the filtered status message on the pager.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Type
member.summary: Defines options for filtering type. The available options are `Menu` - Specifies the filter type as menu. `CheckBox` - Specifies the filter type as checkbox. `FilterBar` - Specifies the filter type as filterbar. `Excel` - Specifies the filter type as checkbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.CaptionTemplate
member.summary: The Caption Template allows user to display the string or HTML element in group caption. > It accepts either the [template string](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/common/template-engine/) or the HTML element ID.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.Columns
member.summary: Specifies the column names to group at initial rendering of the Grid. You can also get the currently grouped columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.DisablePageWiseAggregates
member.summary: If `disablePageWiseAggregates` set to true, then the group aggregate value will be calculated from the whole data instead of paged data and two requests will be made for each page when Grid bound with remote service.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.ShowDropArea
member.summary: If `showDropArea` is set to true, the group drop area element will be visible at the top of the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.ShowGroupedColumn
member.summary: If `showGroupedColumn` is set to false, it hides the grouped column after grouping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.ShowToggleButton
member.summary: If `showToggleButton` set to true, then the toggle button will be showed in the column headers which can be used to group or ungroup columns by clicking them.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridGroupSettings.ShowUngroupButton
member.summary: If `showUngroupButton` set to false, then ungroup button is hidden in dropped element. It can be used to ungroup the grouped column when click on ungroup button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.CurrentPage
member.summary: Defines the current page number of the pager.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.EnableQueryString
member.summary: If `enableQueryString` set to true, then it pass current page information as a query string along with the URL while navigating to other page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.PageCount
member.summary: Defines the number of pages to be displayed in the pager container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.PageSize
member.summary: Defines the number of records to be displayed per page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.PageSizes
member.summary: If `pageSizes` set to true or Array of values, It renders DropDownList in the pager which allow us to select pageSize from DropDownList.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridPageSettings.Template
member.summary: Defines the template which renders customized elements in pager instead of default elements. It accepts either [template string](../../common/template-engine/) or HTML element ID.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridRowDropSettings.TargetID
member.summary: Defines the ID of droppable component on which row drop should occur.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the collection of fields included in search operation. By default, bounded columns of the Grid are included.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: If ignoreAccent set to true, then filter ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.IgnoreCase
member.summary: If `ignoreCase` is set to false, searches records that match exactly, else searches records that are case insensitive(uppercase and lowercase letters treated the same).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.Key
member.summary: Specifies the key value to search Grid records at initial rendering. You can also get the current search key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSearchSettings.Operator
member.summary: Defines the operator to search records. The available operators are:

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.CellSelectionMode
member.summary: The cell selection modes are flow and box. It requires the selection [`mode`](grid/#mode-selectionmode/) to be either cell or both. `Flow`: Selects the range of cells between start index and end index that also includes the other cells of the selected rows. `Box`: Selects the range of cells within the start and end column indexes that includes in between cells of rows within the range. `BoxWithBorder`: Selects the range of cells as like Box mode with borders.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.CheckboxMode
member.summary: Defines options for checkbox selection Mode. They are `Default`: This is the default value of the checkboxMode. In this mode, user can select multiple rows by clicking rows one by one. `ResetOnRowClick`: In ResetOnRowClick mode, on clicking a row it will reset previously selected row and also multiple rows can be selected by using CTRL or SHIFT key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.CheckboxOnly
member.summary: If 'checkboxOnly' set to true, then the Grid selection is allowed only through checkbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.EnableSimpleMultiRowSelection
member.summary: If 'enableSimpleMultiRowSelection' set to true, then the user can able to perform multiple row selection with single clicks.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.EnableToggle
member.summary: If 'enableToggle' set to true, then the user can able to perform toggle for the selected row.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.Mode
member.summary: Grid supports row, cell, and both (row and cell) selection mode.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.PersistSelection
member.summary: If 'persistSelection' set to true, then the Grid selection is persisted on all operations. For persisting selection in the Grid, any one of the column should be enabled as a primary key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSelectionSettings.Type
member.summary: Defines options for selection type. They are `Single`: Allows selection of only a row or a cell. `Multiple`: Allows selection of multiple rows or cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSortColumn.Direction
member.summary: Defines the direction of sort column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSortColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of sort column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSortSettings.AllowUnsort
member.summary: If `allowUnsort` set to false the user can not get the grid in unsorted state by clicking the sorted column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridSortSettings.Columns
member.summary: Specifies the columns to sort at initial rendering of Grid. Also user can get current sorted columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Grids.GridTextWrapSettings.WrapMode
member.summary: Defines the `wrapMode` of the Grid. The available modes are: `Both`: Wraps both the header and content. `Content`: Wraps the header alone. `Header`: Wraps the content alone.

member.summary: Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in header. By default, the format is short. Possible formats are: `Short` - Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header. `Narrow` - Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header. `Abbreviated` - Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header. `Wide` - Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Calendars.EjsDateRangePicker.Depth

member.summary: Enable or disable the persisting component's state between the page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. startDate 2. endDate 3. value

member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.summary: Specifies the component to be disabled which prevents the DateRangePicker from user interactions.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Calendars.EjsDateRangePicker.EndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Calendars.EjsDateRangePicker.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture. > For more details about firstDayOfWeek refer to [`First day of week`](../../daterangepicker/customization#first-day-of-week) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Calendars.EjsDateRangePicker.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies the placeholder text to be floated. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Calendars.EjsDateRangePicker.Format
member.summary: Sets or gets the required date format to the start and end date string. > For more details refer to [`Format`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/demos/#/material/daterangepicker/format.html)sample.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Calendars.EjsDateTimePicker`1.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in header. By default, the format is short. Possible formats are: `Short` - Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header. `Narrow` - Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header. `Abbreviated` - Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header. `Wide` - Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the component is enabled or not.

member.summary: The `fields` property maps the columns of the data table and binds the data to the component. text - Maps the text column from data table for each list item value - Maps the value column from data table for each list item iconCss - Maps the icon class column from data table for each list item groupBy - Group the list items with it's related items by mapping groupBy field

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.FilterType
member.summary: Determines on which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action. The available [`FilterType`](../../auto-complete/filtering/#change-the-filter-type) and its supported data types are

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies whether to display the floating label above the input element. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the footer container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](../../drop-down-list/templates) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.GroupTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. > For more details about the available template options refer to [`Template`](../../drop-down-list/templates) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.Highlight
member.summary: When set to true, highlight the searched characters on suggested list items. > For more details about the highlight refer to [`Custom highlight search`](../../auto-complete/how-to/custom-search) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: ignoreAccent set to true, then ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.IgnoreCase
member.summary: When set to false, consider the [`case-sensitive`](../../auto-complete/filtering/#case-sensitive-filtering) on performing the search to find suggestions. By default consider the casing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.ItemTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup. We have built-in `template engine`

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.MinLength
member.summary: Allows you to set [`the minimum search character length'] (../../auto-complete/filtering#limit-the-minimum-filter-character), the search action will perform after typed minimum characters.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.NoRecordsTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to popup list of component when no data is available on the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of the DropDownList component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.PopupHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height of the popup list. > For more details about the popup configuration refer to [`Popup Configuration`](../../drop-down-list/getting-started#configure-the-popup-list) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.PopupWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the component. > For more details about the popup configuration refer to [`Popup Configuration`](../../drop-down-list/getting-started#configure-the-popup-list) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.Query
member.summary: Accepts the external `query` that execute along with data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.Readonly
member.summary: When set to true, the user interactions on the component are disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.DropDowns.EjsAutoComplete`1.ShowPopupButton

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsMaskedTextBox.CustomCharacters
member.summary:
Sets the collection of values to be mapped for non-mask elements(literals) which have been set in the mask of MaskedTextBox. In the below example, non-mask elements "P" accepts values "P" , "A" , "p" , "a" and "M" accepts values "M", "m" mentioned in the custom characters collection.
For more information on customCharacters, refer to [customCharacters](../../maskedtextbox/mask-configuration/#custom-characters).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsMaskedTextBox.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Sets a value that enables or disables the persisting state of the MaskedTextBox after reloading the page. If enabled, the 'value' state will be persisted.

member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.summary: Sets a value that enables or disables the MaskedTextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsMaskedTextBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary: The acts as a label and floats above the MaskedTextBox based on the below values. Possible values are: Never - The floating label will not be enable when the placeholder is available. Always - The floating label always floats above the MaskedTextBox. Auto - The floating label floats above the MaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsMaskedTextBox.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as disabled, value etc., to the element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsMaskedTextBox.Mask
member.summary: Sets a value that masks the MaskedTextBox to allow/validate the user input. Mask allows [`standard mask elements`](../../maskedtextbox/mask-configuration/#standard-mask-elements) as mask elements. For more information on mask, refer to [mask](../../maskedtextbox/mask-configuration/#standard-mask-elements). If the mask value is empty, the MaskedTextBox will behave as an input element with text type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.EjsMaskedTextBox.Placeholder

member.summary: It is used to denote the type of the Slider. The available options are: default - Used to select a single value in the Slider. minRange - Used to select a single value in the Slider. member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChunkSize
member.summary: Specifies the chunk size to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order. If the chunk size property has value, the uploader enables the chunk upload by default. It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RemoveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server. The remove action type must be POST request and define removeFileNames attribute to get file information that will be removed. This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.SaveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server. The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component. The upload operations could not perform without this property.

Set the orientation property as "Horizontal" to create a horizontal splitter that aligns the panes left-to-right. Set the orientation property as "Vertical" to create a vertical splitter that aligns the panes top-to-bottom.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. Position 2. Type

member.summary: Specifies the Sidebar in RTL mode that displays the content in the right-to-left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.IsOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets the Sidebar component is open or close. > When the Sidebar type is set to `Auto`, the component will be expanded in the desktop and collapsed in the mobile mode regardless of the isOpen property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.MediaQuery
member.summary:
Specifies the media query string for resolution, which when met opens the Sidebar.
> For more details about mediaQuery refer to [`Auto Close`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/auto-close/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.Position
member.summary: Specifies the position of the Sidebar (Left/Right) corresponding to the main content. > For more details about SidebarPosition refer to [`position`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/getting-started/#position) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.ShowBackdrop
member.summary: Specifies the whether to apply overlay options to main content when the Sidebar is in an open state. > For more details about showBackdrop refer to [`Backdrop`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/getting-started/#enable-backdrop) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.Target
member.summary: Allows to place the sidebar inside the target element. > For more details about target refer to [`Custom Context`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/custom-context/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.Type
member.summary: Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar. `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area. `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side, and shrinks the main content within the screen width. `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of main content area based on the sidebar width. The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width. `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions. > For more details about SidebarType refer to [`SidebarType`](../../sidebar/variations/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Sidebar. By default, the width of the Sidebar sets based on the size of its content. Width can also be set in pixel values.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsSidebar.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-index of the Sidebar. It is applicable only when sidebar act as overlay type.

member.summary: Triggers when the state(expand/collapse) of the component is changed.

member.summary: Triggers when component is closed.

member.summary: Triggers when component is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTab.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Tab display mode when Tab content exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container holds the items that can be placed within the available space and rest of the items are moved to the popup. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements can be viewed by scrolling the popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsToolbar.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar display mode when Toolbar content exceeds the viewing area. Possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Prioritized elements are displayed on the Toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup. - MultiRow: Displays the overflow toolbar items as an in-line of a toolbar. - Extended: Hide the overflowing toolbar items in the next row. Show the overflowing toolbar items when you click the expand icons. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.Orientation
member.summary: Specified the orientation of Menu whether it can be horizontal or vertical.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.ShowItemOnClick
member.summary: Specifies whether to show the sub menu or not on click. When set to true, the sub menu will open only on mouse click.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.Target
member.summary: Specifies target element to open/close Menu while click in Hamburger mode.

member.summary: Specifies the template for Menu item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.Title
member.summary: Specifies the title text for hamburger mode in Menu.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.Close
member.summary: Closes the Menu if it is opened in hamburger mode.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.EnableItems(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: This method is used to enable or disable the menu items in the Menu based on the items and enable argument.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.HideItems(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})

member.summary: It is used to insert the menu items before the specified menu item text.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.Open

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.RemoveItems(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: It is used to remove the menu items from the Menu based on the items text.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsMenu.ShowItems(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: This method is used to show the menu items in the Menu based on the items text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end. For more information on drag and drop nodes concept, refer to [Drag and Drop](../../treeview/drag-and-drop/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.AllowEditing
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `allowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. For more information on node editing, refer to [Node Editing](../../treeview/node-editing/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.AutoCheck
member.summary: Allow us to specify the parent and child nodes to get auto check while we check or uncheck a node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.CheckedNodes
member.summary: The `checkedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property. For more information on checkedNodes, refer to [checkedNodes](../../treeview/check-box#checked-nodes).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.EnableHtmlSanitizer
member.summary: Defines whether to allow the cross-scripting site or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enables or disables persisting TreeView state between page reloads. If enabled, following APIs will persist. 1. `selectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component. 2. `checkedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component. 3. `expandedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are expanded in the TreeView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.ExpandOn
member.summary: Specifies the action on which the node expands or collapses. The available actions are, `Auto` - In desktop, the expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node, and in mobile devices it happens on single-click. `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `None` - The expand/collapse operation will not happen when you single-click or double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.ExpandedNodes
member.summary: Represents the expanded nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be expanded or get the ID of the nodes that are currently expanded by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.FullRowSelect
member.summary: On enabling this property, the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node. When disabled only the corresponding node's text gets selected. For more information on Fields concept, refer to [Fields](../../treeview/data-binding#local-data).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: By default, the load on demand (Lazy load) is set to true. By disabling this property, all the tree nodes are rendered at the beginning itself.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.NodeTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a template to render customized content for all the nodes. If the `nodeTemplate` property is set, the template content overrides the displayed node text. The property accepts template string [template string](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/base/template-engine.html) or HTML element ID holding the content. For more information on template concept, refer to [Template](../../treeview/template/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Represents the selected nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be selected or get the ID of the nodes that are currently selected by using this property. On enabling `allowMultiSelection` property we can select multiple nodes and on disabling it we can select only a single node. For more information on selectedNodes, refer to [selectedNodes](../../treeview/multiple-selection#selected-nodes).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Indicates that the nodes will display CheckBoxes in the TreeView. The CheckBox will be displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the node. For more information on CheckBoxes, refer to [CheckBox](../../treeview/check-box/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order, or are not sorted at all. The available types of sort order are, `None` - The nodes are not sorted. `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order. `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.AddNodes(System.Object,System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Adds the collection of TreeView nodes based on target and index position. If target node is not specified, then the nodes are added as children of the given parentID or in the root level of TreeView.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.BeginEdit(System.Object)
member.summary: Instead of clicking on the TreeView node for editing, we can enable it by using `beginEdit` property. On passing the node ID or element through this property, the edit textBox will be created for the particular node thus allowing us to edit it.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.CheckAll(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks all the unchecked nodes. You can also check specific nodes by passing array of unchecked nodes as argument to this method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.CollapseAll(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Collapses all the expanded TreeView nodes. You can collapse specific nodes by passing array of nodes as argument to this method. You can also collapse all the nodes excluding the hidden nodes by setting excludeHiddenNodes to true. If you want to collapse a specific level of nodes, set level as argument to collapseAll method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.DisableNodes(System.Object)
member.summary: Disables the collection of nodes by passing the ID of nodes or node elements in the array.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.EnableNodes(System.Object)
member.summary: Enables the collection of disabled nodes by passing the ID of nodes or node elements in the array.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.EnsureVisible(System.Object)
member.summary: Ensures visibility of the TreeView node by using node ID or node element. When many TreeView nodes are present and we need to find a particular node, `ensureVisible` property helps bring the node to visibility by expanding the TreeView and scrolling to the specific node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.ExpandAll(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Expands all the collapsed TreeView nodes. You can expand the specific nodes by passing the array of collapsed nodes as argument to this method. You can also expand all the collapsed nodes by excluding the hidden nodes by setting excludeHiddenNodes to true to this method. To expand a specific level of nodes, set level as argument to expandAll method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.GetAllCheckedNodes
member.summary: Gets all the checked nodes including child, whether it is loaded or not.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.GetDisabledNodes
member.summary: Gets all the disabled nodes including child, whether it is loaded or not.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.GetNode(System.Object)
member.summary: Get the node's data such as id, text, parentID, selected, isChecked, and expanded by passing the node element or it's ID.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.GetTreeData(System.Object)
member.summary: To get the updated data source of TreeView after performing some operation like drag and drop, node editing, node selecting/unSelecting, node expanding/collapsing, node checking/unChecking, adding and removing node. If you pass the ID of TreeView node as arguments for this method then it will return the updated data source of the corresponding node otherwise it will return the entire updated data source of TreeView. The updated data source also contains custom attributes if you specified in data source.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.MoveNodes(System.Object,System.Object,System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Moves the collection of nodes within the same TreeView based on target or its index position.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.RefreshNode(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Refreshes a particular node of the TreeView.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.RemoveNodes(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the collection of TreeView nodes by passing the array of node details as argument to this method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.UncheckAll(System.Object)
member.summary: Unchecks all the checked nodes. You can also uncheck the specific nodes by passing array of checked nodes as argument to this method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.EjsTreeView`1.UpdateNode(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the text of the TreeView node with the given text.

member.summary: Specifies the icon class that is used to render an icon in the Tab header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabHeader.IconPosition
member.summary: Options for positioning the icon in the Tab item header. This property depends on `iconCss` property. The possible values are: - Left: Places the icon to the `left` of the item. - Top: Places the icon on the `top` of the item. - Right: Places the icon to the `right` end of the item. - Bottom: Places the icon at the `bottom` of the item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabHeader.Text
member.summary: Specifies the display text of the Tab item header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabItem.Content
member.summary: Specifies the content of Tab item, that is displayed when concern item header is selected.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabItem.CssClass
member.summary: Sets the CSS classes to the Tab item to customize its styles.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabItem.Disabled
member.summary: Sets true to disable user interactions of the Tab item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabItem.Header
member.summary: The object used for configuring the Tab item header properties.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TabItem.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the header text of Tab item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarEvents.Clicked
member.summary: The eventwillbefiredon clicking the Toolbar elements.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarEvents.Created
member.summary: The event will be fired when the control is rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarEvents.Destroyed
member.summary: The event will be fired when the control gets destroyed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Align
member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be disabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents`1.OnKeyPress

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents`1.NodeChecking

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents`1.NodeCollapsing

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Navigations.TreeViewEvents`1.OnNodeDragged

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.NewestOnTop
member.summary: Specifies the newly created Toast message display order while multiple toast's are added to page one after another. By default, newly added Toast will be added after old Toast's.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.Position
member.summary: Specifies the position of the Toast message to be displayed within target container. In the case of multiple Toast display, new Toast position will not update on dynamic change of property values until the old Toast messages removed. X values are: Left , Right ,Center Y values are: Top , Bottom

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.ShowCloseButton

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.Target
member.summary: Specifies the target container where the Toast to be displayed. Based on the target, the positions such as `Left`, `Top` will be applied to the Toast. The default value is null, which refers the `document.body` element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be displayed as a Toast. The given template is taken as preference to render the Toast, even if the built-in properties such as title and content are defined.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.TimeOut
member.summary: Specifies the Toast display time duration on the page in milliseconds. - Once the time expires, Toast message will be removed. - Setting 0 as a time out value displays the Toast on the page until the user closes it manually.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Notifications.EjsToast.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toast in pixels/numbers/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. In mobile devices, default width is considered as `100%`.

member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the dialog can be closed with the escape key that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.Content
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in dialog's content area. It can be information, list, or other HTML elements. The content of dialog can be loaded with dynamic data such as database, AJAX content, and more.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the dialog. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.

member.summary: Defines whether to allow the cross-scripting site or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.EnableResize
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be resized by the end-user. If enableResize is true, the dialog component creates grip to resize it diagonal direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the template value that can be displayed with dialog's footer area. This is optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. By default, the footer is configured with action [buttons](#buttons). If footer template is configured to dialog, the action buttons property will be disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.Header
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with plain text or HTML elements. This is optional property and the dialog can be displayed without header, if the header property is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.IsModal
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be displayed as modal or non-modal. `Modal`: It creates overlay that disable interaction with the parent application and user should respond with modal before continuing with other applications. `Modeless`: It does not prevent user interaction with parent application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Blazor.Popups.EjsDialog.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the dialog.

member.summary: Specifies the z-order for rendering that determines whether the dialog is displayed in front or behind of another component.
